Response from https://webhook.closedloop.ai:843/bitbucket-scmsource-hook/notify\\
Request status: NET_ERR\\
Elapsed time: 38ms\\
Request time: a minute ago (Monday, March 12th 2018, 4:44:51 pm)\\
Request\\
Attempt type: Initial attempt\\
Headers\\
X-Request-UUID	f3a19b39-3df0-4797-9ec7-6110bb66d89a\\
X-Event-Key	repo:push\\
User-Agent	Bitbucket-Webhooks/2.0\\

fields.description: I wrote a comment "inline" the code of a pull requests. Then the commiter answered my comment, and an email came to mail inbox with the title _"Re: [Bitbucket] Pull request BCLOUD-12.. "_ and with the text in the body, and a link to the comment like this https://bitbucket.org/my-company/my-project/pull-requests/1234/name-of-the-pr#comment-1234568 , i open the link in my browser, but the is no such a comment, i can't see my comment nor the commiter answer, only PR comments (those that aren't inline comment) are visible.
fields.summary: "Inline" comments are not visible after commiter respond

fields.description:
I have a private repository in my team - the project, the repository and every setting has it set to Private.

I did a pull request and went in to view it. In the bottom right hand corner I can sometimes see the avatars of other people viewing the pull request at the same time as me.

However on a couple of occasions now, I've noticed avatars who are nothing to do with my team or organisation in the bottom right hand corner, when you hovered over them with the mouse pointer, it said "xxxxx is viewing this pull request" etc.

This is disconcerting!!! Either the notifications system is broken and reporting inaccuracies, or other people can see pull requests in my private repositories. Could you investigate please, is this a known bug?
fields.summary: External people can see private repositories? (!!)

fields.description:
I have a README.rst file in my project, around 600 lines. The file is always rendered correctly when I access the file directly on Bitbucket, but in the project's or a branch's overview it is rendered in only about half of the cases. I just keep on refreshing the page and the rendering is either there or not, seems random to me. Why is this happening? People that want to see the overview of my project often stumble upon this broken rendering and I keep on receiving complaints about broken documentation. Whereas it's just enough to refresh the Bitbucket's project overview page 2-3 times.

Is it a bug or am I doing something wrong?

In order to ensure that it's not because of some complicated markup, I extracted the simplest part of my document and multiplied it several times, so that I have a resulting .rst file of about 1200 lines (but without complicated markup). I attach this file to the issue, so that you can test.

If it's not the right place to report this problem, please tell me where to go.

Thank you very much!
fields.summary: .rst readme files rendered successfully only sometimes

fields.description:
Can we have the ability to create positive feedback on the lines of code in the form of 'likes'.

This is a bit immature, but for me, reviewing a PR is finding the faults of the author of the pull request. It would be great if as a reviewer I can send positive feedback to the author, this can happen when I learned something new/think something is cool from the code or when a commit about your comment is pushed  and I want to let the author know this is what I suggested.

I realize this is super trivial, so disregard this if you want haha
fields.summary: Allow Pull Request reviewers to 'like' lines of code on the overview tab

fields.description:
When I give feedback on a pull request the author sometimes responds with changes. The commit messages of those changes are then sent as email communication of the pull request. Unfortunately the commit messages only display the subject (first line) of the commit message. It doesn't include part of the body of the commit message like is shown in the pull request commits interface on the website. Not showing the body of the commit message can make the utility of these messages less useful.

This is a request to have the body also included in the email, if appropriate, as it is in the website interface.
fields.summary: Pull request commit emails don't include commit body message

fields.description:
We started using the pipelines cache with our node builds recently.\\
It definitely accelerates the builds, but we have found a problem when we update a module's version that is a dependency for the actual build that is caching the node_modules.

Basically, if you have a dependency that gets updated to a newer version (for example an internal module hosted in a private node registry).  The cache does not update.\\
Upon build and install it works because the local node_modules gets updated, but the cached version doesn't get updated... so the next step if you don't run "npm install" as well, it will download the un-updated version of the cache and cause issues (say for example on a deployment step).  Ideally we wouldn't have to do npm install on every step...

So this issue is about seeing if its possible to make the cache update every time a a change in the node_modules directly is detected.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Pipelines caches with node does not refresh dependencies when a module is updated

fields.description:
We have a projet in node with webpack.\\
If we run pipeline commands directly from the latest docker images of node:9-alpine, everything is Ok.\\
In bitbucket, the pipeline fails.

The attached archive contains code to reproduce.

The relevant part of the error message is:

{code}
ERROR in ./src/index.js
Module parse failed: /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/src/index.js Unexpected token (9:10)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type.
|    * Webpack fails with this declaration in pipelines
|    */
|   getProp = () => this.props;
| 
|   setProp(props) {
error An unexpected error occurred: "Command failed.
Exit code: 2
Command: sh
Arguments: -c ./node_modules/.bin/webpack
Directory: /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines build fails when webpack babel processing doesn't run on JS files

fields.description:
I just ran into this case: a branch was renamed from using '-' to '_' (because a docker tag apparently cannot have '-'). After renaming the new branch was pushed and the branch with old name was removed from origin.\\
However, the pc from which this was done was not up-2-date and therefore some commits from the branch were lost.

The lost commits could be retrieved via the bitbucket pipeline since that links to the commit which was build. Unfortunately, there is no way in BitBucket to add a label to this commit, either a tag or branch, to make these lots commits available again.

In contrast to other non-orphan commits, the commit view does not allow adding a tag to the commit. That might be a simple change which would make 'those-who-lost-commits' live a lot simpler.\\
Or, allow making a branch from a commit.
fields.summary: Allow restoring orphaned commits by adding a tag or branch

fields.description:
!1113057997-Screen%20Shot%202018-03-08%20at%2012.07.32.png|thumbnail!

Now the merge strategy needs to be selected on each PR merge and the default value is to "merge".

Make this configurable at repo level and allow to set different value.

For example we want to be able to set to always use --squash when merging PRs and have this at repo level so it doesn't need to be selected each time when PR is merged as people forget to do that. And also maybe sometimes we don't want to allow people to have this option and we want all PRs to be merged as it's configured in repo settings page.
fields.summary: Make the merge strategy of a PR configurable at repo level instead of PR and allow to set different default.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Large markdown files doesn't render in multiple browsers. The file renders correctly after several refreshes but fails most of the time
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open large Markdown file in Bitbucket UI

h3. Expected Results

Markdown file renders successfully in Bitbucket UI
h3. Actual Results

Markdown file doesn't render in Bitbucket UI and throw 404 error in Dev console
h3. Workaround
 * Try to refresh the file in Bitbucket UI
 * Split the file in small files
fields.summary: Rendering Large markdown files doesn't work

Or is there any other way to get refresh_token.

As well I wanted to call this API as GET API.

Can please someone help.

Thank You!

fields.description:
Commits are currently inheriting the user who was the author of the commit or pull-request, not the user who actually did a pull-request merge and created that new commit.

eg.

!216549247-Screen%20Shot%202018-03-07%20at%2013.37.19.png|thumbnail!\\
!248496707-Screen%20Shot%202018-03-07%20at%2013.36.51.png|thumbnail!

On the new "Your Work" landing page, there is an option to show "Broken Builds".  I cannot find any docs on this, so perhaps it is just not done yet, but it seems to do nothing.

What are we supposed to see with that?  It sounds very promising, and perhaps a partial answer to a [Pipelines broken builds dashboard|BCLOUD-12765] (assuming it can be configured to show your entire team's broken builds, and not just a single user's)

fields.description:
As with it breaking on [pipelines|BCLOUD-14615], the keyboard shortcuts do not work on the new Your Work page, which is especially frustrating since that is the landing page for bitbucket.org, which I often go to and then use {{.}} or {{/}} to go to the repo/page I need.

Note that if I mouse click on the left nav bar, then keyboard shortcuts do work again.  But of course having to mouse click to shift focus to the actual bitbucket app defeats the purpose of keyboard shortcuts.

It would be nice if you could find a universal solution to your internal add-ons/features (Your Work, Pipelines, etc) to still have access to the keyboard shortcuts of the main bitbucket application.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts fail on new Your Work page

fields.description:
The search feature is very nice, but it's difficult to navigate.  Somewhere in the mix if you could display all of the file names your search term was found in, rather than having to go thru all of the pages manually, this would be very helpful.

So if the word "ImportantClass.cs" was found in 5 repositories, out of 100 repositories, that would be helpful to know in a convenient spot.  Today, as far as I can tell, you have to go thru all the search results manually page by page.  Maybe these search results are a set of radio buttons like "output type" -- one option would be the normal way you have it today, google-like, the second option is more of an index of filenames or some reasonable categorization.
fields.summary: Add option for file names only, on search results

fields.description:
Hey,

in my understanding of bitbucket pipelines, the bitbuckets-pipelines.yml that is used for a run, is picked from the branch i run the pipeline on.

So lets say i have a "feature1"-branch, if i manually trigger a pipeline, it will be the version of the "feature1" > bitbucket_pipelines.yml.

Isn't this some kind of insecure in terms of people with write access can echo my environment variables just by modifying and manually running a pipeline?

So i can only give write access to the repo to somebody who is allowed to access server environments too?

And how am i supposed to secure my production deployment pipeline against running them manually on lets say "feature1"-branch and deploying feature1?

I mean, i am limiting write access to my master branch via branch permissions, but this seems not to hold anybody from deploying to my production environment.
fields.summary: Access rights on manually running a pipeline

fields.description:
For the reasons stated in this Forum comment:\\
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Can-I-trigger-Bitbucket-pipeline-with-pull-request/qaq-p/226236#U741911

it would really be useful to either have a setting that enables running pipelines automatically on PR, or, second best option, have a "Run Pipelines" button on a PR that allows the submitter to run that.

This is particularly useful for either accounts limited to 50 min free runs (which quickly run out if used on ALL branches) or even for paying users who may not want to use them needlessly.

I also think it makes good developer practice to only review PRs that pass the tests; it makes no sense to review faulty code.

fields.description:
We've just written an XML file to the test-reports directory as part of the BitBucket Pipeline. Mainly to see what reports are presented/stored.

There are 20,217 tests in the suite. This is being reported as 40,434 tests.

From the PHPUnit test run ...

{code}
Time: 6.94 seconds, Memory: 36.00MB
OK, but incomplete, skipped, or risky tests!
Tests: 20217, Assertions: 54042, Incomplete: 2323.
{code}

From the BitBucket Pipeline Build Teardown report

{code}
Located test suite containing 108 tests, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
Located test suite containing 2106 tests, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
Located test suite containing 20217 tests, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
Finished scanning for test reports. Found 1 test report files.
Merged test suites, total number tests is 40434, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
Uploading test results
Finished uploading test results.
{code}

Initially, I thought I'd pushed up one of our local reports, but as you can see only 1 test report is found.

In addition, this report seems less useful that I'd expect. Is there a different way to see this report or is this feature just to summarise all the unit test outputs at the end of the build?

If it is just to summarise, then doubling the number of tests is probably not a great way to show this. I expect any failures would also be doubled, potentially making things look twice as bad as they really are.
fields.summary: The merging of the xUnit reports presents twice as many tests as there actually are.

fields.description:

error fetching bundle: [Errno 11004] getaddrinfo failed\\
abort: error applying bundle\\
hint: if this error persists, consider contacting the server operator or disable clone bundles via "--config ui.clonebundles=false"\\
[command returned code 255 Sat Mar 03 14:50:59 2018]
fields.summary: error fetching bundle: [Errno 11004] getaddrinfo failed

fields.description: The ReasonML language ( http://reasonml.github.io/ ) is gaining traction and it would be good to provide syntax highlighting for it. As a stopgap, an easy solution is to highlight Reason source code ({{*.re}} files) as OCaml, because their syntax and language keywords are sufficiently similar.
fields.summary: Support ReasonML syntax highlighting

fields.description: I attempted to create a repository (code_ref) earlier (on Mar 2 2018) when there were reported http issues with bitbucket.org. It may have been created incorrectly. Now, there are no longer http issues and I am able to create and access _new_ repositories. however, when I now try to access this previously created "code_ref" repository, I am getting the message and am stuck at this stage.
fields.summary: Stuck on "Please wait a moment while we create your repository"

fields.description:
When i am creating a Pull request for JSX file it does'nt shows the difference - Diff correctly. Just two line - 1. One with pink denoting whole file is removed 2. Second line green with a + sign denoting its added.

I made change on the file and added 10 LOC. This is happening from day one and would like to know if there is a way the format can be changed in bitbucket to view the change, the same way we see in classes.
fields.summary: JSX file view in Diff page is incorrect Format.

fields.description:
I am new in bitbucket. so first i create my login there and create two repositories. one is public and one is private. when i am trying to publish my existing project from VS2013 to bitbucket then i am getting error as following

*You cannot publish local branch master to the remote repository origin because a branch with the same name already exists there. You might want to rename your local branch and try again.*

screen shot  enter image description here\\
!4170625186-btbt.png|thumbnail!

i followed this article http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/using-bitbucket-with-visual-studio-2015/

some one please guide me why i am getting the above error when i am trying to add my existing local project to bitbucket git?

Thanks
fields.summary: Publish project to BitBucket from VS2013

fields.summary: After merging a pull request, if you delete the source repository, the pullrequest view will result in a 500 error (BBCDEV-9272)

fields.description: I am able to successfully install a fairly common Perl module according to cpanm but this somehow signals Pipelines that this script command had failed.  I am attaching a screenshot that shows a successful installation and subsequent build fail (redacted my company's private CPAN mirror and marked the output lines that indicate success).  The docker image I'm using is perl:5.24.
fields.summary: Perl Successful Module Installation Fails Pipelines Build
